uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize

Class Region.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize.Region.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Region

    public static class Region.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for creating Region instances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(Region region)
      Create a builder and initialize the weights from the given region.
      Builder(RegionUtility utility)
      Create a builder for the region which, for now, assigns weight 0 to everything.
      Builder(RegionUtility utility, java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> backward, java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> forward)
      Create a builder for the region with the given weights.

        Parameters:

        backward - The backward weights.
        forward - The forward weights.

    • Method Detail

      • addLoopAround

        public Region.Builder addLoopAround(java.lang.String event,
                                    java.math.BigInteger weight)
        Add a loop with the given weight around the given event. This means that the backward weight and the forward weight are both increased by the given weight.
        Parameters:
        event - The event on which a loop should be added.
        weight - The weight that should be added.
        Returns:
        This builder instance.

      • addLoopAround

        public Region.Builder addLoopAround(int index,
                                    java.math.BigInteger weight)
        Add a loop with the given weight around the given event. This means that the backward weight and the forward weight are both increased by the given weight.
        Parameters:
        index - The event index on which a loop should be added.
        weight - The weight that should be added.
        Returns:
        This builder instance.

      • addRegionWithFactor

        public Region.Builder addRegionWithFactor(Region region,
                                          java.math.BigInteger factor)
        Add the weights of a region with some factor applied to our current state. Adding a region with a factor of one means that its backward and forward weights get added to our backward and forward weights. Adding a region with a factor of minus one means that its backward weights get added to our forward weight, and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        region - The region to add.
        factor - The factor that should be used.
        Returns:
        This builder instance.

      • makePure

        public Region.Builder makePure()
        Turn this builder's weight into the weight for a normal region. This modifies the weight so that the effect of each event is still the same, but at least one of the forward or the backward weights are zero.
        Returns:
        This builder instance.

      • withInitialMarking

        public Region withInitialMarking(java.math.BigInteger initial)
        Create a region from the current state of the builder and the given initial marking.
        Parameters:
        initial - The initial marking of the region.
        Returns:
        A new region corresponding to the weights that are currently in this builder.

      • withNormalRegionInitialMarking

        public Region withNormalRegionInitialMarking()
        Create a region from the current state of this builder and the initial marking that a normal region would have. Please note that the normal region marking is only valid for pure region. Also, of course the region has to be cycle-consistent (going through a cycle reaches the same value again).
        Returns:
        a new region corresponding to the weights that are currently in this builder.

      • createPure

        public static Region.Builder createPure(RegionUtility utility,
                                        java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> vector)
        Create a new region builder for a pure region with the given weights.
        Parameters:
        utility - The region utility that should be used.
        vector - A vector which contains the weight for each event in the order described by utility.
        Returns:
        A region builder containing the given weights.
